newsitem.title: FRANCE: French economy shrank 0.4 pct in second quarter.
newsitem.headline: French economy shrank 0.4 pct in second quarter.

text.p: France's economy shrank 0.4 percent in the second quarter from the first quarter, hit by a sharp fall in consumer spending, national statistics institute INSEE said on Wednesday.
Economists had expected a fall of 0.2 to 0.4 percent after a sharp rebound in the first quarter as the economy recovered from a paralysing public sector strike at the end of last year.
INSEE said it was revising the rise in the first quarter to 1.1 percent from 1.2 percent.
Consumer spending, hit by high unemployment which has sapped confidence, fell 1.0 percent in the second quarter after rising 2.5 percent in the first.

The French government is counting on a rebound in growth in the second half of the year, fuelled by recent interest rate cuts, to help it reduce public deficits in preparation for European monetary union.
